title: 4 reasons why the Ether price can't break $1,970 - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ether (ETH) price faces resistance at $1,970 due to four reasons:

1. Macro headwinds from the Fed, including higher odds of interest rate hikes and tighter regulatory environment.
2. Withdrawals from Ethereum smart contract applications, which slowed the June rally.
3. Diminished investor interest in cryptocurrencies due to Fed Chair Jerome Powell's suggestion of two more interest rate hikes in 2023.
4. Regulatory challenges, including the EU's controversial Data Act and Binance Australia's corporate office search.

The Ethereum network is facing its own challenges, including Vitalik Buterin's statement on multisignature wallets.

The total value locked (TVL) in Ethereum's smart contracts has reached its lowest level since August 2020.

Professional traders have increased their leveraged long positions in Ether futures, but the 25% delta skew indicator suggests

title: New ERC-20 token VMPX triggers Ethereum burn spike, consumes $3M in gas fees in 24 hours - CryptoSlate
summary: New ERC-20 token VMPX is causing a spike in Ethereum burns, consuming $3M in gas fees in 24 hours. The token's minting contract has no purpose except to increase network gas usage, according to software engineer 0xCygaar. VMPX has consumed nearly 1,500 ETH in gas fees, representing 30% of all gas fees spent in the last 24 hours. Gas fees have jumped to as high as 76.3 Gwei, according to Ultrasound.money.

title: Ethereum Users Have Been Burning ETH To Mint VMPX Tokens - Yahoo Finance
summary: Ethereum users have been burning ETH to mint VMPX tokens, a new asset designed to connect the Bitcoin and Ethereum blockchains. As of July 6, VMPX led all contracts in terms of burned ETH, with $90M burned so far. The XEN ecosystem, which includes VMPX, has been experimenting with multichain technology and has been successful in expanding its reach across various blockchains. The founder of XEN, Jack Levin, explained that the project is similar to a marketing token in a game like Monopoly, allowing users to mint VMPX without buying it from anyone. Unlike many other projects, XEN doesn't have a "premine" and instead wants to go back to the roots of Bitcoin creation by not raising any money.

title: Analyst Updates Bitcoin and Ethereum Price Targets, Predicts Coming 18 Months Will Be an ‘Absolute Pleasure’ - The Daily Hodl
summary: Analyst predicts bullish price targets for Bitcoin and Ethereum, with a possible reach of $42,000 for Bitcoin by April 2024 and $2,500 for Ethereum by Christmas 2023. The analyst bases their predictions on the behavior of the options market, with a high demand for call options and a low put-call ratio for both cryptocurrencies. The analyst believes that the next 18 months will be an "absolute pleasure" for investors, with fast price movements and potential gains.

title: After Bitcoin's Hard Forks, Ethereum Classic (ETC) Enjoys an Uptrend Amidst Rising Momentum - Securities.io
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 words or less:

The cryptocurrency market saw a decline on Wednesday, with Bitcoin and Ethereum Classic (ETC) experiencing a slight uptrend. The Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting minutes revealed that officials favor raising interest rates, which put pressure on the market. However, derivatives markets signal bullishness, and institutional investors are active in crypto futures. Bitcoin Cash (BCH) and Bitcoin SV (BSV) also saw significant gains. ETC, a lesser-known cryptocurrency, joined in on the uptrend, with its price rising 4.1% against USD. Despite the positive momentum, ETC faces challenges with adoption and security concerns. The article concludes that if ETC can keep up with the momentum, it could surge further in July, but if selling pressure prevails, the price could drop to $18.

title: Ethereum Whale Transfers Over 25,000 ETH To Exchange: Massive Dip On The Horizon? - NewsBTC
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum whale transfers 25,264 ETH to Coinbase, worth $48 million. Another 30,000 ETH was transferred to OKEX. These large transactions may indicate a short-term surge in volatility, but could also herald an upcoming uptrend. Ethereum's price has been following Bitcoin's, but these transfers suggest it may move independently. Market capitalization has surged over $3 billion in the past week, with daily trading volume increasing from $6 billion to $12 billion.

title: Pikamoon, a blockchain game on Ethereum, raises $3.6m, final ICO phase in progress - crypto.news
summary: Pikamoon, a blockchain game on Ethereum, has raised $3.6 million in its ongoing ICO, with the final phase currently in progress. The game aims to revolutionize the blockchain gaming space by offering a realistic metaverse game with an earning model that allows players to withdraw their in-game rewards directly to their wallet or bank account. The game is built on Unity technology and uses dual blockchain features of Ethereum and MultiversX to ensure smooth and environmentally friendly gameplay. Notable partners include Ethereum, Transak, Cryptonews.com, Kevuru Games, and MultiversX. The PIKA token has a deflationary nature, with 0.5% of tokens burned whenever a sell or transfer transaction occurs in the Pikamoon ecosystem. The game offers endless opportunities for players to explore, battle, trade, and earn a living within the game, and the unique earning model allows players to easily monetize their gameplay.

title: The Unseen Gas Guzzlers: A Deep Dive into Rising Ethereum Gas Fees - CryptoTicker.io - Bitcoin Price, Ethereum Price & Crypto News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Ethereum gas fees have been rising, and a recent tweet by Cygaar revealed that a specific contract is responsible for a significant portion of the increase. The contract causes validators to run unnecessary or useless code, which increases gas usage and puts a strain on the network. This leads to congestion and higher gas prices, making transactions more expensive for users. The community is now calling for a solution to address this issue and ensure the network's long-term sustainability.

title: Ethereum NFT royalties hit 2-year low as Bored Ape floor price falls below 30 ETH - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum NFT royalties have reached a 2-year low, according to a report by Nansen, with creators earning an estimated $75.7 million in a single week in April 2022. However, the latest drop in the floor price of Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC) NFTs and the controversy surrounding the launch of the Azuki Elementals collection have contributed to the decline in royalties. The top 10 NFT collections have earned over $345 million in royalties, with Yuga Labs accounting for 44% of that amount. Only 20 NFT projects have earned over $10 million in royalties to date.

title: Crypto's Indiana Jones? Coinbase exec helps recover $322K of once-lost crypto - Cointelegraph
summary: Coinbase exec helps recover $322K of once-lost crypto: Conor Grogan, director of product strategy & business operations at Coinbase, helped recover $322,000 worth of dormant crypto for a lucky investor. Grogan tracked down the funds by searching through ETC rich lists, combing through each wallet, and leveraging new information to connect with the holder's EOS wallet. The wallet owner was unaware of their long-lost riches, and Grogan was able to inform them of their funds.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin below $30,500; Ethereum holds $1,900; Polygon sheds 5% - Business Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin and other top crypto tokens fell after the release of June Federal Reserve minutes, with Bitcoin dropping below $30,500. Ethereum held $1,900, but other altcoins saw significant declines, with Polygon down 5%. The global cryptocurrency market cap dropped below $1.2 trillion, but trading volumes surged 11%. The crypto fear and greed index is down 5 points but remains in the greed zone. Tech View analysts expect Filecoin (FIL) to reach $5.1 resistance and $3 support.

title: Crypto Meta Transactions - Milk Road
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Crypto transactions face usability issues, particularly the need for gas fees, which can be a barrier for everyday users.

Meta transactions enable gasless transactions, simplifying the user experience and bringing the ecosystem closer to frictionless adoption.

There are two types of meta transactions: centralized and decentralized relays. While centralized relays are easy to integrate, they contradict decentralized networks. Decentralized relays face synchronization problems.

The most well-established initiative pioneering meta transactions is Open Zepplin's Gas Station Network (GSN). GSN is an open-sourced community-driven effort that creates a decentralized and trustless mechanism for leveraging meta transactions.

The Gas Station Network consists of relayers, or gas stations, that accept etherless transactions, fill them with gas, and relay them to the network. Relayers are required to stake ETH to prevent certain attacks.

From the user's perspective, everything is done transparently, autonomously, and in a timely

title: The History of NFTs - LCX
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

NFTs have had a significant impact on business growth and mainstream media. The history of NFTs began with the creation of the first NFT, Quantum, in 2014. In 2017, NFTs gained popularity, and the COVID-19 pandemic accelerated interest in NFTs. High-value NFT sales, such as Beeple's $69 million sale, have sparked interest in the technology. Other notable NFT sales include Edward Snowden's $5 million sale and a CryptoPunks NFT sold for approximately $11 million. New uses of NFTs, such as simulated environments and blockchain games, have emerged to attract attention to the technology. Well-known brands, such as Taco Bell and Coca-Cola, have also demonstrated an interest in NFTs.

title: Avalanche and DogeMiyagi: Leveraging Ethereum's Growth Model - Analytics Insight
summary: In this article, the author discusses the recent growth of Ethereum and how it has set a benchmark for newer projects like Avalanche and DogeMiyagi. Ethereum experienced a 61% surge in the first half of the year, leading to a notable transaction involving 63,250 "bull call spreads" linked to ether. The article highlights the growth potential of Ethereum and how newer projects can learn from its success in establishing itself as the world's largest smart-contract blockchain. Avalanche and DogeMiyagi can leverage Ethereum's approach to scalability, security, and developer community engagement to attract more users and developers. Additionally, they can draw inspiration from Ethereum's vibrant ecosystem of decentralized applications and tokenized assets, and create innovative features that provide value to their respective communities. The article concludes by stating that by studying and applying the growth model of Ethereum, Avalanche and DogeMiyagi can position themselves as promising projects in the crypto market.

title: As Ethereum (ETH) Price Stagnates, On-Chain Analytics Predict 180% Spike For InQubeta (QUBE) and Eos (EOS) - Analytics Insight
summary: InQubeta (QUBE) and Eos (EOS) are expected to experience a 180% price spike due to their unique utilities, deflationary mechanism, and association with Ethereum. In contrast, Cardano and Polygon are facing challenges due to increased regulatory scrutiny, leading to significant declines in their prices. The ongoing presale of InQubeta has raised over $900,000 and has attracted retail investors seeking to become a part of an AI ecosystem with massive potential. InQubeta's presale accepts popular cryptocurrencies and has a minimal entry fee of $50, making it accessible and convenient for investors. The token's deflationary mechanism, staking rewards, and governance features position it for substantial growth in the coming years, with a potential 100x increase in its price by 2024.

title: Uniswap v4: Launch Hinges On Ethereum's Upcoming Cancun Upgrade - Bitcoinist
summary: Uniswap v4 launch hinges on Ethereum's Cancun upgrade, with a tentative timeline for later this year. The upgrade includes a security audit, which could take up to four months. Uniswap v4 introduces a modular exchange structure, smart contracts, and a novel flash accounting system to lower fees for liquidity providers. The Uniswap team believes this mechanism will reduce transaction costs on the new product. The next steps for Uniswap v4 include protocol code freeze and successful inclusion of EIP-1153 into the Cancun upgrade. The launch is eagerly awaited by the crypto community, which could reshape the DeFi landscape. UNI price has been sideways in the past 24 hours, with a market price of $5.39 at the time of writing.
